text: George Dureau (December 28, 1930 - April 7, 2014) was an American visual artist. His career lasted forty years. He was known for charcoal sketches and black and white photography. His work was often called homoerotic. He was born in New Orleans, Louisiana. Dureau died from Alzheimer's disease on April 7, 2014 at the Walden Healthcare Center in Kenner, Louisiana. He was 84 years old. ==References== ==Other websites== * George Dureau biography Category:1930 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American artists Category:American photographers Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease- related deaths in Louisiana Category:People from New Orleans
title: George Dureau
